description: the app crashes all the time
Parts that got move (e.g. Base/Placement-Function) are not exported to the stl-fromat correctly. (It seems they get moved double to what is entered in Base/Placement)
Great open-source CAD software with lots of functionality.
You learn through tutorials and then you apply

FreeCAD takes parametric modeling to another level. Like many other opensource-projects, the tools available here are kept low-level and well-thought. These tools work very good together and thus allow a high level of abstraction of your model. Once mastered them, a designer can create very, very parametric models.

Cause FreeCAD is marriaged with python, it's sooper easy to dig into the gears of the software and adjust, extend and automate.
-
FreeCAD is still in BETA 0.something: Expect complications (most wanted issue in my opinion: Topological Naming Issues), master them and enjoy the evolution of another rising opensource-star month by month.
summary: A Rising Star! Best CAD-Concepts ever used

description: definitely the most handy and abilifying app in the fedora repositories right now
summary: should be a standard component of fedora workstation

description: Prior to discovering this, I used Blender for 3D modelling. It's early days for me using this. I think, once I get my head around the workflow, this will be much more useful.
summary: Another high quality, open source product with many on-line resources

description:
Let's be clear here, FreeCAD is far from perfect, it has some bugs that will see it crash horribly and the learning curve isn't just steep, it's well lubed too. There are some tutorials on YT and the web (Dr. Vax is a good place to start, because Irv is such a super chap) but you'll soon outgrow that.

I've been using Blender for years now and it suits just about everything I do. Except 3D printing. While it's possible to design models in Blender for 3D printing, I've found it tricky to get stuff lined up to sub-mm accuracy.

I'm designing my own rudder pedals for Flightgear (etc.) and this has given me a lot of headaches and the chance to learn FreeCAD at the same time as I learn to created something from scratch. Although I'll have used a couple of Kg of PLA by the time I finish this thing (assuming I don't give up in the process) FreeCAD has consistently delivered accurate prints that don't have non-manifold edges.

While Blender is (and will remain) my go to app for artistic and movie work, FreeCAD has made it possible to design models that work in the real world with very little fuss. Any delays are largely due to my poor understanding of the workflow which is largely down to getting your head around the idea that parts are made from multiple "sketches" which are then solved and applied by the system as pads, holes, pockets and so on. 

Blender models often left me with bits that I couldn't see (without using X-Ray) that confused the 3D printer's slicing software. That's not a criticism of Blender, it's just that it's designed for a different job where the visible parts are all that matters.
summary: Amazing alternative to Fusion (and even Blender)

description: Workbenches fail to load from this RPM version.
it's not perfect but has te necesary tools to make functional eng drawings
The integration (rpm) isn't great, there are window decorations missing, making it almost impossible to use. Use the flatpack instead, it's very usable.
summary: FreeCAD great, integration in Fedora not

description:
I've switched from SolidWorks to FreeCAD 2 years ago.
FreeCAD is harder to learn but has much more to offer:

Because it's a work in progress - the interface is confusing and there's a lot to figure out online rather than in the UI. Sometimes, you even need to learn how to prevent a bug that results in a crash.

However, the way you can describe the generic nature of your design, using lot's of references, python and various - coordinate-system based concepts, is way more powerfull than in SolidWorks and has dried all my tears.

When you start using macros and making your own, very special plugins for FreeCAD (with ease) you quickly catch up the "lost" time from initial learning.

Just because FreeCAD is open-source i'm awaiting a very steep evolution-curve, once it has reached a level that i accepted and used by enough users - just the way currently happening with Blender.
summary: The best coming up generic CAD - already good enough to jump in

description: TechDraw has a bug where I can't setup line weights in Fedora. The lines on an exported pdf are barely visible.
FreeCad works really good, there is a bug every now and then.
I'm confident this will be the most widely used CAD program world wide.  Thank you to the developers for making this happen.
Autodesk is friendlier, But this is free fast and fine if you don't break its rules

I think this program is amazing. It is very ambitious it what it does. It is not perfect... but that is why the revision number is less than 1.0. The truth is, however, that while bugs appear to be thre, I never run into them. It is rock solid for me.

I love that it runs natively on Linux, and allows me too use a space mouse. I know the trendy thing is to jump on board with F360, but why not give this a try? There is nothing I haven't been able to do in it yet -- and F360 isn't Linux-Friendly. I won't boot to windows just to do CAD work.
Ubuntu 18.04: starts to load then self-terminates

Have been using it on Ubuntu, Manjaro & Fedora.
If you know SW you will wrap your head around it pretty quickly, also you can find great tutorials on YT to get started.
Sure it doesn't have all the features of SW but there are enough options for linux like photo realistic renders (Blender), the electrical side (KiCad) or even simulations (OpenFOAM)

description:
You need both Mindset and Methods. Start with a tutorial! https://wiki.freecad.org/Tutorials. Quickly seeing the basics helps. (For me, it was the Lego-block, years ago.) 

FreeCAD is a broad & deep piece of software for all sorts of projects. Features surpass just 3D CAD/CAM for designers & engineers & architects.

FC is NOT a clone of commercial proprietary software. Fools expecting it to be so will be upset (the bad reviews reveal impatient ignorance and cognitive deficit).

It's its own beast, ploughing its own FLOSS furrow, the result of many many hours of extremely talented & diverse programmers' volunteer efforts over years. And it's in VERY active development!

So it's ALWAYS IMPROVING.

Don't expect to go expertly into FreeCAD based on familiarity with other 3D software. There IS a learning curve. Not everything's GUI-intuitive. Be prepared to RTFM, although the Wiki suffers its share of "to-be-updated" like all active-project documentation.

Which leads to ONE OF THE BIGGEST ASSETS of the project: the FreeCAD WEB FORUM. It's amazing. Probably because of the demographic - with lots of helpful mature engineer types, intelligent & articulate, natural problem-solvers - the speed & quality of COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE for both newbies and veterans is superb. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Yes, there ARE still gaps and rough edges in FC, areas where you're reminded of the old saying about "committees making race-horses ending up with camels" but honestly, looking past superficial, willing to accept quirks, camels can be MORE useful & desirable in MORE places!

Its real beauty is it's FLOSS, which means users CAN participate & contribute & fix those rough edges & fill those gaps if able & willing.

Freedom-software is about LIBERATING users, about IN-cluding and EM-powering.

An important aspect of this empowerment is the ABSENCE OF VENDOR LOCK-IN, that common ploy by monopolist rentiers seeking repeat revenue. There's no one in the FreeCAD project holding hostage your many hours of creative input. No one peddling proprietary file-formats and demanding ransomware payments for you to access your projects from different years & versions.

FreeCAD's truly free-as-in-Freedom not just free-beer.

The core is C++, but the huge ecosystem extending it is Python. That's one reason it's so active. People can and do get involved.

The development version is generally recommended over the stable version, for its breakneck pace of fixes & features. Weekly AppImages are a simple (if download-heavy) way to run it.

Parametric 3D-modelling needs a mindset.

Be willing to suspend prior conditioning, take some time learning the BASIC PRINCIPLES of parametric 3D-modelling AND HOW IT'S ACHIEVED WITH THE TOOLS IN FreeCAD, then you'll realise just how useful FC can be. 

From casual illustrators & hobbyists to full-time experts in academia and industry, people DO use the FC toolbox in real projects & careers. 

It's only getting better. And it's FREE. 

RECOMMENDED!
Works great. No installation or excecution problems. Currently no update to 0.21.
This isby far the worst User Interface i've ever seen. prepare to RTFM for every single action you want to do because NOTHING is made to be simple, extremely user unfriendly.

Love it. Got past the initial learning curve and persevered. It runs well on Ubuntu albeit crashing occasionally, probably due to bugs. Never lost a lot of work due to regular saving and goodautomatic backup saving.

Drawn a good 3d Live steam loco on it and dsigned my own version of a 3d printed Steam Loco with an electric motor tucked away. Exports good stl files without any problem.

Good range of workbenches. Just install what you need. 

For free sofware it's great and meets all my needs with scope for experimentation and extra learning as time allows. It helps that I'm retired now so have the time.

Just another example of linux neckbeards making software for aliens and not humans. I Have used it for many years and it is really improving at an accelrating rate. Its usable and fast for most CAD tasks once you spend a bit of time learning and will soon be better than many of the big money CAD programs.

I support free and open software, but it's clear from the "zero" prefix on the version number that this software isn't quite ready for professional use.

My drawing disappears whenever the software detects a geometric error.

Drawing a torus with a given inner and outer radius has given me problems, along with trying to retroactively change that torus's dimensions.

Sometimes the software will temporarily freeze when it's working hard to calculate what a given operation (such as adding a solid) should look like. It does not give me an indication of how long the calculations should take.

If an extrusion of a 2D drawing results in multiple solids, then it gives an error. Two adjacent rectangles that share a side will produce 2 adjacent prisms that shares a face after the extrusion process; unfortunately, this counts as "multiple solids", and the operation cannot be performed.

These are just some examples of the hiccups that I've faced, and for my purposes, there are enough of these hiccups that they coalesce into roadblocks that make this software impossible for me to use for the specific applications I have in mind.

I have nothing but respect for the people who work on this software for free on their own time, but I'm afraid that I will need to revert back to using Blender3D for precision engineering drawings (which comes with its own set of problems).

Basic functionality works nicely, but things like addon manager or openscad integration doesn't seem to work with this package.

So it's a convenient way of getting a stock FreeCAD and using it, but if you need more functionality use the native package instead
summary: Basic functionality works, but forget plugins with this package

I have used Solidworks, Inventor and Catia before, but FreeCAD is the hardest to learn and use.
Just to mention a few inconveniences form hundreds:
1 - Thumbnail previews don't work in any Linux file manager. This is the ultimate breakdealer because if you cannot see the thumbnails in the file manager, then to find anything will turn into a real nightmare. 
2 - Common modeling is split between 2 incompatible workbenches (Part and PartDesign) and models made with one have trouble being used by the other.
3 - It lacks a default assembly module and as replacement, there are 3 incompatible Addons. Translated: an assembly created with one addon is incompatible with the rest.
4 - Developers don't appear to actually use (as a regular user) this software and as a result the interface and workflow is awful, when not almost impossible to work with.
5 - There is a high inertia among active developers which, I believe, paralyzed them and make them fearful to make the necessary changes in order to make this software at least productive. 
6 - In the FreeCAD forum complains about the above are met with resistance and answers like "this is the FreeCAD way".

My final judgment: use only if you have no choice and A LOT of time to waste in workarounds and browsing tutorials and solutions online,
summary: Use it only if you have no choice

Das Programm ist super. Es ist nach einer Einarbeitung sehr gut zu bedienen. Falls es zu Problemen kommt, gibt eine freundliche Community und es wird ständig weiterentwickelt. Für mich als privater User kommt nichts anderes in Frage. 5-Sterne.

bad UX and buggy
Zwar existieren viele Bugs mit Abrunden und Abschrägen, die zu unbrauchbaren Ergebnissen führen können, braucht man die aber nur beschränkt (dort, wo's geht), ist die Software durchaus brauchbar.

Version 0.21.1 ist sehr umfangreich, nicht immer intuitiv, aber analytische Geometrie braucht eben echte Logik. Das Problem liegt zwischen den Ohren: hat man die Zusammenhänge begriffen, klappt es. Für Anerkennung unter den CAD-Spezialisten braucht es noch etwas DINISO-Streamlining mit professionellen Werkzeugen des Maschinenbaus, also normgerechte Features z.B. bei TechDraw. Auch Freiformflächentools sind prima, wenn auch die Logik dahinter erst begriffen werden muss. Anfänger haben es trotz Tutorials nicht leicht, da die volle Dokumentation oft fehlt zum Nachlesen, wie es eigentlich geht. Add-ons sind etwas problematisch, da sie gefühlt unprofessioneller von Einzelnen gemacht werden und nicht von Gruppen? Didaktische Anfängerhilfen sind psychologisch wichtig für die weitere Verbreitung.

Hervorragende positive Entwicklung durch super Entwicklerteam, Hut ab!
Unbedingt unterstützen durch Nutzung und Kommentierung der eigenen Erfahrungen.
summary: wird immer professioneller, grosser Dank an die Entwickler

Une fois que l'on a compris le principe du dessin paramétrique, l'application des contraintes dimensionnelles et l'arborescence de construction, il n'existe plus rien d'impossible ou de compliqué à dessiner. Les tutoriels pour y parvenir sont nombreux sur le Web et bien faits. De plus, l'ajout d'addons permet de travailler dans des contextes (ateliers) spécialisés, comme l'architecture, les engrenages mécaniques, la résistance des matériaux (FEM), la conception de bateaux ou d'avions, la topologie et les données géoréférencées, ...
Pour ce qui est de la conception 3D, je le trouve plus efficace et convivial que les logiciels propriétaires professionnels que j'utilise tous les jours dans le cadre de mon métier.
Merci aux développeurs de FreeCAD.

Bien que le FreeCad soit assez intuitif, difficile de donner du volume en 3D à un projet en DXF... J'ai bien chercher des tutoriels sur le web, et j'en ai trouvé mais impossible à le faire avec FreeCad 0.18 sous Fedora 32, donc obligé de télécharger 0.19 pour le faire fonctionner sous wine.
Nombreux bugs, et impossible de réduire la taille des pignons ou engrenages pour du modélisme aérien...

Au moins un bug...

Export d'une pièce en STL (sans passer par l'export mesh) parait sauvé (aucune signalisation d'erreur) sur la destination voulue mais le fichier n'est pas créé.
trés bon logiciel de modélisation 3d open source.
summary: Logiciel de CAO génial, je recommande

description: Prise en main rapide et efficace

That's what I'd call a fully featured tool. It rivals big expensive softwares like fusion 360 and includes many tools that you wouldn't find anywhere. 
Plus the file format is actually a plain zip of xml files. I wrote a little script to expand and get it back to the good format to save the xml expanded to a git repo so that we can save plain xml files, track changes and collaborate. That software is really precious and easy to use especially if you intend to make 3d printing.

Super application; je l'ai adopté et l'utilise pour tous mes besoins, j'ai complètement abandonné les logiciels que j'utilisais car freecad est universel et dispose d'un large soutien sur internet pour toute question. Je recommande; vraiment cela vaut la peine d'investir un peu de temps pour apprendre à l'utiliser. Il a tellement de possibilités que je pense que je n'en ferai jamais le tour. Un grand merci au(x) dévelopeur(s), génial !
Parfait pour modeler et concevoir
De mieux en mieux, FreeCAD à gagné en stabilité et en fonctionnalités au fil du temps. Bravo aux développeurs !
Je l'utilise pour créer mes modèles 3D de composant pour Kicad, le rendu est parfait quand on maitrise ce logiciel. En plus il existe de nombreux tutos.
On ne présente plus freecad. Merci aux dévellopeurs de nous permettre d'avoir un logiciel aussi puissant tout en étant libre et gratuit.
Validé par le SNTS.

je l'utilise depuis 6 ans non seulement il ma rappelé des outils professionnele hyper couteux mais en plus il évolue c'est vraiment une solution complete.
Et ile n'est pas encore ne version 1 il ne peut que s'améliorer.

Je viens de créer une pièce assez complexe grâce a la fonction de console, c juste un truc de malade mentale, par contre je detesterai toujours les commandes de ce genre de logiciel tout comme blender, c completement contre-intuitif et c'est très enervant ! mais la joie de pouvoir créer de la 3d sans licence et avec l'aide de la console python, c'est incroyable ! je suis fou de joie !
summary: Monstrueux grace a la console python !

description: Не безглючно, но с удовольствием пользуюсь много лет - модели для ЧПУ станка(раньше пользовался отдельным CAM, сейчас встроенным), модели для 3d-принтера, в 0.19 версии появилась и возможность делать 2d чертежи, вполне понимаемые на производстве. На FEM пока только облизываюсь - некогда(но есть и работает), а некоторые модули даже не знаю что делают(что-то для архитекторов, и проч.) плюс есть удобный интерфейс для поиска и установки расширений( как пример- для импорта в 3d печатных плат из Kicad)....
вдруг неожиданно обновился до 0.19. правда не полностью руссифицировался, но в целом стал даже удобнее.
Спасибо ребятам!
Спроектировал дом для себя в нем. Отличная программа, но требуется серьезное освоение.
Пользуюсь им несколько лет. Конечно, до AutoCAD'а далеко, но для моих нужд вполне хватает. С каждым обновлением много чего изменяется, что радует. Молодцы разработчики!

За 1.5 часа использования, и создании модели по мануалу у меня десять раз сгорела жопа, даже в родной вики, в инструкции для новичков не указывается куда жать, где искать кнопки, на каждое действие есть отдельная статья со сраной простыней текста, хоткеи для действия надо искать где-то в этой простыне, хотя тебе нужно было просто применить что-то, господи, я не знаю ни одной программы, которая была бы НАСТОЛЬКО запутанная и сложная, тебе нужно реально потратить очень много времени для освоения каких-то базовых принципов, я не представляю, что там дальше
FreeCad (version-0.19) использую для фрезерного станка.Тема на 99% рабочая.
Использую для создания 3Д моделей для своего 3Д-принтера. Огромные возможности, всё просто не изучить.
Удобно для создания 3д моделей.
от сложного моделирования до простого, всё может
Можно на нем спроектировать корпус судна (лодки или яхты)? Или в какой проге лучше?

Проблемы с импортированием файлов из AutoCad. Даже конвертеры не спасают, проект становится либо полностью не рабочим, либо частично. Не удаляйте оригиналы не проверив проект полностью. А если у вас паралельная работа по проекту, то соболезную.
долго разбираться , логика создания проектов и отрисовка далека от обще принятой . крякнутый SolidWorks гораздо интереснее
В умелых руках вполне серьёзный инструмент. Сейчас появилось много уроков в Ютубе именно по этой программе. Опыт использования 2 года.
